channel.title: Windows 10
channel.description:
[center][img]http://e5c351ecddc2f880ef72-57d6ff1fc59ab172ec418789d348b0c1.r69.cf1.rackcdn.com/images/Xq5YV8etWI_C.878x0.Z-Z96KYq.jpg[/img][/center] So I am interested in your thoughts on Windows 10? http://www.engadget.com/2015/01/21/windows-10-event-new-pc-features/ It looks ok so far, but we wont really know until we get more hands on. I tried downloading and installing the tech preview on a VM at work, but it kept failing. http://www.pcgamer.com/microsoft-windows-10-will-not-be-sold-as-a-subscription/
You can upgrade to Windows 10 for free if you have Windows 7 or 8. You will not pay for it. After that year is up, nothing will happen to your Windows 10 license. If you do not upgrade within that year, however, you will have to pay for an upgrade. The offer expires after a year, not the upgrade.
This is one of the biggest bonuses about it. Microsoft is really pushing people to dump Windows 7 & 8

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:21, topic:549337”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=668240.msg4469921#msg4469921 date=1422400622]
Every time I touch my gf’s computer which has w8 I want to throw that thing into the wall.
The fudgeing tiles and apps, I can’t get used to it. And the access to configuring your system is a hell,
half of the time when I want to do stuff I notice it’s just not there and you need to use a whole workaround.

And damn how do I hate the “sharing-connectivity” moto. I just want to use the damn computer, I don’t feel the need
to sync everything everywhere or talk to my damn computer.
And forcing an outlook account? what? I want to use the computer, not check my mails or some shit.

I’m going to continue dual booting linux and w7 and when the support stops for w7 I assume it’s going to be Linux only for me.

[size=7pt]Yes I know I have the mindset of an old man that can’t adapt to the technological evolution.[/size]
[/quote]

I installed windows 8.1 on my main desktop at home, and I didn’t have any problems with it. Windows 8 when it first came out had its problems. Most of the problems then were just drivers. Once I got into the groove of things it wasn’t that bad. But, I think people will find it easier to move from Windows 7 - 10, rather than 7 - 8. There are still a few things I don’t like with windows 10. But over-all so far I enjoy it. I recommend people downloading the Tech Release and installing it onto a VM.[/quote]
Might do that, pretty sure I still have VMware around somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:17, topic:549337”]Every time I touch my gf’s computer which has w8 I want to throw that thing into the wall.
The fudgeing tiles and apps, I can’t get used to it. And the access to configuring your system is a hell,
half of the time when I want to do stuff I notice it’s just not there and you need to use a whole workaround.

And damn how do I hate the “sharing-connectivity” moto. I just want to use the damn computer, I don’t feel the need
to sync everything everywhere or talk to my damn computer.
And forcing an outlook account? what? I want to use the computer, not check my mails or some shit.

I’m going to continue dual booting linux and w7 and when the support stops for w7 I assume it’s going to be Linux only for me.

[size=7pt]Yes I know I have the mindset of an old man that can’t adapt to the technological evolution.[/size][/quote]

I installed windows 8.1 on my main desktop at home, and I didn’t have any problems with it. Windows 8 when it first came out had its problems. Most of the problems then were just drivers. Once I got into the groove of things it wasn’t that bad. But, I think people will find it easier to move from Windows 7 - 10, rather than 7 - 8. There are still a few things I don’t like with windows 10. But over-all so far I enjoy it. I recommend people downloading the Tech Release and installing it onto a VM.

Read full topic

to sync everything everywhere or talk to my damn computer.
And forcing an outlook account? what? I want to use the computer, not check my mails or some shit.

I’m going to continue dual booting linux and w7 and when the support stops for w7 I assume it’s going to be Linux only for me.

[size=7pt]Yes I know I have the mindset of an old man that can’t adapt to the technological evolution.[/size]

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:12, topic:549337”]i know that. did you even read what i asked?

can i play the games on my sp3 or is it simply mirroring from the TV?[/quote]
You will be able to play from your SP3, but I don’t think anyone knows how it really works yet. We do know that one person can play on the xbox while another plays the same game on PC, so I’m pretty sure its not mirroring

http://www.pcgamer.com/microsoft-windows-10-will-not-be-sold-as-a-subscription/

You can upgrade to Windows 10 for free if you have Windows 7 or 8. You will not pay for it. After that year is up, nothing will happen to your Windows 10 license. If you do not upgrade within that year, however, you will have to pay for an upgrade. The offer expires after a year, not the upgrade.

This is one of the biggest bonuses about it. Microsoft is really pushing people to dump Windows 7 & 8
